column5: We always bought our dry ice at the Cenex gas station at south end of town (International Falls). I doubt they would have it at this time of the year.
Does anyone sell dry ice in Sioux Lookout?

Check out Camcarb in Sioux Lookout. They are a compressed gas cylinder distributor there and may have it for retail sale. Their phone number is 416-745-1304. My guess is that it is going to be pricey. Camcarb.com PjShorthorn
Have never been able to find it there. We get ours in Dryden on the way home.

How far of a drive does one have to take to require dry ice for fish? After a 17 hour drive home mine is still frozen, just using a cooler with maybe a couple of gatoraid bottles of frozen water. Are you at out post camps that have no freezer?

Was thinking the same thing. When we leave Ear Falls to return home to Chicago, we place frozen fillets in a cooler filed with frozen blue ices. The cooler is not a Yeti quality cooler - just one of those 3day extreme cooler. Now granted the cooler Hass been on the inside of our air conditioned vehicle. However I don't think dry ice is really necessary unless you are traveling a long distance home. Just my two cents.
We are two day drive. We leave the camp at 5 in the morning and going to North Dakota the first day. .
Couple spots in I falls has dry ice. Nice stops for lunch anyway.
Back in the 80's we would buy dry ice from a diary in Dryden . Now with coolers like the yeti. Regular ice gets us at least 11 hours
I've never seen a dry ice shop here either word hurdle
If you're traveling through North Dakota South Dakota where there's a lot of big game hunting check out a meat processing place they probably sell dry ice too
